summary: The code imports the HyREPL module from hy.cmdline and initializes an instance of it called "repl". It prints a message before running the REPL, then runs the REPL using the repl.run() method. After that, it prints another message after the REPL. The code aims to demonstrate a normal usage of HyREPL.

details.comment: The code imports the HyREPL module from hy.cmdline and initializes an instance of it called "repl". It prints a message before running the REPL, then runs the REPL using the repl.run() method. After that, it prints another message after the REPL. The code aims to demonstrate a normal usage of HyREPL.
details.content:
import hy.cmdline
# this is different. no access to hidden member.
print('message before repl')
repl = hy.cmdline.HyREPL() # this is not reliable. exit will exit this shit for good.
repl.run()
print('message after repl')
# no message after repl?
